newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares power to new records.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares power to new records.

text.p: Some leading Russian shares surged on Wednesday on what dealers said was a new inflow of Western money, but traders said a slight technical correction began before the market closed.
The Russian Trading System index of 22 shares shot to a record 447.94 close on a record $100.27 million market turnover.
But some dealers said the market had already started to lose steam in the last few hours of trade.
"This is just a market rally," said United City Bank head of securities Dmitry Yevenko. "But we are already seeing a light technical correction since the market is clearly overheated."
National electricity company UES rose to $0.4055 after closing on Tuesday at $0.3724, but it was off a daily $0.4152 high.
International long-distance provider Rostelekom RTKM.RTS ticked up to $4.45 after $3.97, but down from $4.49 earlier.
Oil company Surgutneftegaz SNGS.RTS firmed to $1.120 from $1.095, while metals producer Norilsk Nickel NKEL.RTS edged up to close unofficially at $10.20 after $9.65.

"The market is strong but I so far have an ambiguous impression -- these levels are strangely high, although I don't rule out they will be higher," said Raiffeisenbank Austria's head of corporate securities, Sergei Sheikov.
Yevenko said investors were taking positions based on expectations of an increase in Russia's attractiveness for investment.

"In September, Russia will be given a new (international credit) rating. It is clear it will be better...Many clients can (take positions) now," he said, adding the market could see support on Thursday if, as analysts expect, the U.S. Federal Reserve does not raise interest rates.
